info.title: Antifraud Provider API
info.description:
>ℹ️ Onboarding guide
>
> Check the new [Payments onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/payments-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Payments and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

The Antifraud Provider Protocol is a set of definitions to help you integrate your antifraud service API into VTEX platform.

To achieve this, you need to implement a web API (REST) following the specifications described in this documentation.

>⚠️ You can also access our [template on GitHub](https://github.com/vtex-apps/antifraud-provider-example) to help you quickly develop your anti-fraud connector using the Antifraud Provider Protocol and VTEX IO.

To learn more about the Antifraud Provider Protocol, check our [Developers article](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/how-the-integration-protocol-between-vtex-and-antifraud-companies-works).

## Antifraud Provider API Index

### Antifraud  Flow

- `POST` [Send Antifraud Pre-Analysis Data (optional)](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/pre-analysis)
- `POST` [Send Antifraud Data](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/transactions)
- `PUT` [Update Antifraud Transactions (optional)](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#put-/transactions/-transactionId-)
- `GET` [List Antifraud Provider Manifest](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#get-/manifest)
- `GET` [Get Antifraud Status](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#get-/transactions/-transactions.id-)
- `DELETE` [Stop Antifraud Analysis (optional)](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#delete-/transactions/-transactions.Id-)

### OAuth Flow

- `POST` [1. Retrieve Token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/authorization/token)
- `GET` [2. Redirect](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#get-/redirect)
- `GET` [3. Return to VTEX](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#get-/authorizationCode)
- `GET` [4. Get Credentials](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#get-/authorization/credentials)

post.description:
Receives a new transaction antifraud data for (synchronous) pre-analysis. This step is performed before payments authorization.

>⚠️ This endpoint can only be used if your anti-fraud provider already has the pre-analysis function configured within VTEX. To check if it is already configured, in the VTEX Admin, go to **Store Settings > Payments > Settings> Gateway affiliations tab > {your antifraud provider option}** and verify if the **Enable risk Pre-Analysis** field is available to be selected. If the **Enable risk Pre-Analysis** field is not available, check with your antifraud provider if this feature is available in their integration and open a ticket in our VTEX support to update the connector.

>⚠️ The pre-analysis does not exclude the need for full analysis after payments authorization.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppKey
parameters.description: The AppKey configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppToken
parameters.description: The AppToken configured by the merchant.

post.description:
Receives a new transaction antifraud data. This step is performed only if all payments are authorized.

VTEX expects that your antifraud provider process this request and retrieves the process result. After that, the VTEX order flow will check the response status to cancel or approve the transaction.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppKey
parameters.description: The AppKey configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppToken
parameters.description: The AppToken configured by the merchant.

put.description:
Receives a new transaction antifraud data. This step is performed only if all payments are authorized.

VTEX expects that your antifraud provider process this request and retrieves the process result. After that, the VTEX order flow will check the response status to cancel or approve the transaction.

get.description: Returns the custom fields of the antifraud provider manifest.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description: This endpoint is used to get the antifraud analysis status. This request is performed every two hours up to 5 days. After 5 days in `undefined` status, the order will expire and be cancelled.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppKey
parameters.description: The AppKey configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppToken
parameters.description: The AppToken configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: transactions.id
parameters.description: VTEX transaction ID. This parameter is the same `id` sent in the request body of the [Send Antifraud Data endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/transactions).

delete.description: This endpoint is used to notify whether the order has been canceled by the store or the buyer before completing the antifraud analysis status.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppKey
parameters.description: The AppKey configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-API-AppToken
parameters.description: The AppToken configured by the merchant.

parameters.name: transactions.Id
parameters.description: VTEX transaction ID. This parameter is the same `id` sent in the request body of the [Send Antifraud Data endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/transactions).

post.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve a payment provider token.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
Through this endpoint, VTEX will redirect the store administrator to the Payment provider website using the `token` retrieved in the [previous request](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/antifraud-provider-protocol#post-/authorization/token)

At this point in the flow, the provider shows the login site to the store admin and authorizes VTEX to use its integration as a valid Payment Provider Processor. After that, your server generates an `authorizationCode`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token information.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: VTEX application identifier.

get.description:
Through this endpoint, the provider will redirect the store administrator to the VTEX website using the `returnUrl` passed from VTEX to create token.

The `returnUrl` must be filled with your query string **authorizationCode**.

Example:

If you receive the following URL:

`https://store.vtex.com/return?authorizationCode=&otherparams...`

and your **authorizationCode** is `pro2018`. Then, you redirect the store administrator to: `https://store.vtex.com/return?authorizationCode=pro2018&otherparams...`

parameters.name: providerAuthorizationCode
parameters.description: Provider authorization code information.

parameters.name: authorizationCode
parameters.description: Code generate by affiliation that will be used to identify the merchant authorization.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: VTEX application identifier.

cardholderDocument.description: Indicates the requirement of cardholder document in card transactions. The field has three possible values: `required`, `optional`, or `unused`.

id.description: VTEX transaction ID. The ID of the transaction related with this payment.

reference.description: VTEX order reference key. The key of the order (from VTEX OMS system) related with this payment.

ip.description: The original ip address from browser.

store.description: VTEX has a main Name for the store. This unique name is often used in url to access VTEX configurations.

deviceFingerprint.description: Device fingerprint generated by the provider. This is generated by using Google Tag Manager that the provider implements. This field is optional, is sent only if received. See **Implement Device Fingerprint**

hook.description: URL to be called when the payment has it's status changed. For more information, see [Authorization and Callback URL](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/payments-integration-purchase-flows#authorization).

transactionStartDate.description: The date and time when the transaction started. It must be in the ISO 8601 format.

merchantSettings.title: merchantSettings
merchantSettings.description: Custom fields (for the given Provider) which the Merchant must fill. Each element of this array is a key-value pair.

id.description: VTEX buyer ID. The unique identifier of the buyer.

documentType.description: Type of document of the buyer. It depends on the country.

value.description: Shipping value with two decimal places.

id.description: VTEX product ID. The ID of the item.

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the cart.

deliveryType.description: Type of delivery configured by the store.

deliverySlaInMinutes.description: Each item can have a separate shipping sla in minutes.

categoryId.description: Category ID for the Item. Configured by each store.

categoryName.description: Category name for the Item. Configured by each store.

discount.description: Discount applied on item(s) two decimal places.

sellerId.description: In case of a marketplace transaction, this is the Id of the seller for this specific item. Otherwise, this is filled with a '1'.

name.description: List name defined by the store.

deliveryToOwner.description: Flag to mark if the order will be delivered to list creator or not.

id.description: Payment ID unique identifier in VTEX.

method.description: Payment method used for the buyer.

name.description: Payment name used for the buyer. This name could be the brand card or the VTEX payment method.

currencyIso4217.description: The currency used in each payment in the Transaction. It must be in the ISO 4217 format.

bin.description: Abbreviation for 'Bank Identification Number'. It's a code that identifies the institution responsible for issuing the credit card.

lastDigits.description: Credit card identifier number last digits.

id.description: VTEX transaction ID. The ID of this transaction must be in the response.

tid.description: Provider transaction ID. The ID of this transaction must be in the response. The antifraud provider MUST generates an unique transaction Id.

code.description: Error code returned from provider. It will be logged in transaction interactions log.

message.description: Error message returned from provider. It will be logged in transaction interactions log.

status.description: Pre-analysis status from provider. Must be one of the values `approved` or `denied`.

score.description: The value of the risk score. 100.00 as max value means total fraud.

id.description: VTEX transaction ID. The ID of the transaction related with this payment.

reference.description: VTEX order reference key. The key of the order (from VTEX OMS system) related with this payment.

ip.description: The original IP address from the browser.

store.description: VTEX has a main Name for the store. This unique name is often used in URL to access VTEX configurations.

deviceFingerprint.description: Device fingerprint generated by the provider. This is generated by using Google Tag Manager that the provider implements.

id.description: VTEX transaction ID. The ID of this transaction must be in the response.

status.description: Transaction status from provider. Must be one of the values: `approved`, `denied` or `undefined`.

analysisType.description: Analysis type. Valid values are `automatic` or `manual`.

responses.description: Value dictionary to add custom responses from analysis.

id.description: VTEX transaction ID. The ID of this transaction must be in the response.

tid.description: Provider transaction ID. The ID of this transaction must be in the response. The antifraud provider MUST generates a unique transaction Id.

status.description: Transaction status from provider. Must be one of the values: `approved`, `denied` or `undefined`.

analysisType.description: Analysis type. Valid values are `automatic` or `manual`.

applicationId.description: This value is always identified as `vtex`.

returnUrl.description: VTEX website URL. You will redirect the user after they complete login on the payment provider's website. The URL should contain a query string parameter called `authorizationCode` which will be passed empty and which you must fill in before returning the user.

applicationId.description: This value is always identified as `vtex`.

token.description: Payment Provider Token. Used to identify the context after you receive the redirected user to your site.

applicationId.description: This value is always identified as `vtex`.

appKey.description: It will be used in all API requests as X-VTEX-API-AppKey.

appToken.description: It will be used in all API requests as X-VTEX-API-AppToken.
